choices.D: Check the Upsert Key checkbox on the Account Status field
choices.A: Check the Upsert Key and Is Required for Upsert checkboxes on the Account Id field
choices.B: Check Overwrite Target For All Null Inputs checkbox on the Account Id field
choices.C: Populate the Lookup Object and Lookup Fields

comments.content: This is 100% correct. The answer is D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the right answer . Checking upsert key will determine status as a unique. if value is existing the record is updated, else record is inserted as mentioned in the question. If you set the isRequired for Upsert checkbox, it is essentially an update only and will never insert/creat a recrd. but the question does state else record will be created, so answer is D.

Correct Answer: A
Example in youtube video name: "Data Raptor Load | Omnistudio Developer Certification | Vlocity Platform Essential"
i can't put the link

Selected Answer: A
It's supposed to be D, however, the question says to create a new record when there is no ID related instead of throwing an exception.

Selected Answer: A
A. Check the Upsert Key and Is Required for Upsert checkboxes on the Account Id field

By checking the Upsert Key checkbox on the Account Id field, the DataRaptor knows that this field should be used as the unique identifier to determine whether to update an existing record or create a new one. Additionally, by checking the Is Required for Upsert checkbox, the DataRaptor will throw an error if the Account Id field is not provided, preventing the creation of a new record if one doesn't already exist. This ensures that the Account status is updated only if the record already exists.

questions.question_text:
A developer writes an OmniScript that includes a DataRaptor that updates the Account status based on information provided from the OmniScript. The information must be updated only if the Account record already exists. Otherwise, a new account must be created.
How should the developer accomplish this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. A Lookup Input Element
B. A DataRaptor Extract Action

Both a Lookup Input Element and a DataRaptor Extract Action can be used to retrieve data from a Salesforce object. A Lookup Input Element is used to query a single record from an object and map its fields to OmniScript variables. A DataRaptor Extract Action is used to extract multiple records from an object and transform them into JSON format for use in external services.

questions.question_text: Which two of these options can a developer use to retrieve data from a Salesforce object? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C is the correct answer.
Edit Block: Enable users to add, edit, and delete records by using Edit Block's default remote actions. 
Edit Block supports these Actions:
HTTP Action
Integration Procedure Action
Remote Action

Selected Answer: C
C is the right answer

Selected Answer: D
D. Use an Input Block element and a DataRaptor Post Action element.

To allow subscribers to add, edit or delete dependents related to their policy via their Community portal, the developer should use an Input Block element to capture the dependent information from the user and a DataRaptor Post Action element to update the Salesforce records with the new or edited data. The DataRaptor Post Action element can be configured to perform create, update or delete operations on the dependent records based on the user's input.

questions.question_text:
A healthcare company wants to enable its subscribers to add, edit, or delete dependents related to their policy via their Community portal. The developer on the project decides to use an OmniScript.
How should the developer configure the OmniScript to provide this functionality?

choices.C: Use an Edit Block element configured with Remote Actions.
choices.D: Use an Input Block element and a DataRaptor Post Action element.
choices.A: use a Text Block element and a Remote Action element.
choices.B: Use an Edit Block element configured with SOQL statements.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D are correct choices

Selected Answer: BD
B. Add Link to RecordType object in the Contact Object with the Id field of RecordType object.
D. Select RecordType in the Lookup Object list, DeveloperName in the Lookup field list, and ID in the Lookup Requested Field list.
To set the record type of a record in DataRaptor Load, the developer needs to link the record type object to the target object and then map the developer name of the record type to the record type ID.

choices.D: Select RecordType in the Lookup Object list, DeveloperName in the Lookup field list, and ID in the Lookup Requested Field list.
choices.A: Check Is Lookup property when mapping the fields.
choices.B: Add Link to RecordType object in the Contact Object with the Id field of RecordType object.
choices.C: Select RecordType in the Lookup Object list, ID in the Lookup Field list, and DeveloperName in the Lookup Requested Field list.

A developer is configuring a DataRaptor Load to save contact data. The developer needs to set the record type of the contact using DeveloperName.
Which two configuration actions should the developer take to set this up in the DataRaptor Load? (Choose two.)
